meanings.definition: To a small extent or degree
meanings.sent1: She inconsiderably adjusted the volume of the radio.
meanings.sent2: The cat inconsiderably moved closer to the window.
meanings.sent3: He inconsiderably tiptoed around the house, trying not to wake anyone.
meanings.sent4: The sun inconsiderably peeked through the clouds, casting a soft glow.
meanings.sent5: The flower inconsiderably swayed in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: Without regard for the feelings or needs of others
meanings.sent1: The inconsiderably guest left without saying goodbye.
meanings.sent2: It was inconsiderably of him to ignore her request for help.
meanings.sent3: The inconsiderably child grabbed all the toys without sharing.
meanings.sent4: Her inconsiderably comment hurt his feelings deeply.
meanings.sent5: The inconsiderably behavior of the driver angered the pedestrians.
